subject: Business
title: Succession Planning: Preparing Your Replacement
description: A fast breakdown of Succession Planning: Preparing Your Replacement for builders.

hook.text: When Disney CEO Bob Iger retired, his successor lasted two years. Iger had to come back. The succession failed.

buildup.text: Succession planning means developing leaders who can replace you â€” before you need replacing.

discovery.text: The best successions start years early. GE's Jack Welch spent three years vetting his replacement.

twist.text: Founders often resist succession. They confuse the company's identity with their own.

climax.text: Apple's Tim Cook was groomed for years. The smoothest successions look effortless because of invisible preparation.

punchline.text: A leader who can't be replaced hasn't led well enough.

quiz.question: Why do many founders resist succession planning?
options: They confuse the company's identity with their own
They believe the company will close after they leave
Succession is only needed in public companies
